text:
This is a great site to include every kind of favicon imaginable to your site
<https://realfavicongenerator.net/>
(for saving link to android and iphone home screens, windows tiles, mac touchbar etc) This sort of thing would be great as an ‘Advanced Settings’
Could we get textareas for custom modules? <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Textarea-in-Custom-Modules/idi-p/263463#M32505>
Actually, the single-line text becomes multiline when you put in more than one line’s worth of text into it. I found out by copy-pasting a long string into it. :stuck_out_tongue:
ha.  you never jumped off the cliff and typed past the end?
I can't find an Ideas post for the ability to use "Copy to portal" on folders. I'm fairly certain it's been mentioned here before, does anyone know of a post or should I create one?
i havent seen it on the ideas forum.  make it so and i will like the heck out of it
it has been recommended multiple times guess we’ve all been too lazy to make an idea post. Will happily upvote
It is done, please upvote :fire: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Ability-to-use-quot-Copy-to-portal-quot-on-folders/idi-p/263531>
how the eff does <@U7SL518D6> like things so quickly
i wanted to be the first
hahaha
<https://media.giphy.com/media/cMVXLaX5pqrUA/giphy.gif>

I recently created an email template that uses a rich text module. But I noticed the content editor was increasing the font sizes and since it sets inline styles I would have to write !important. But !important doesn't work well with Outlook. So in order to help maintain brand consistency, I think there should be a global developer setting to prevent certain rich text features. Please vote if you agree <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Allow-developers-to-disable-inline-styles-on-rich-text-modules/idi-p/263549#M32627>
Nope, never had an occasion to before now.

I haven’t actually noticed this, I think you’re using a HubSpot default email, which uses the content settings email values. I usually avoid using those in my email templates because clients change them or don’t understand they affect other emails

“in the works”
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Ability-to-use-quot-Copy-to-portal-quot-on-folders/idc-p/263557/highlight/true#M32629>
Hi Jon. So are you saying you don't use rich text modules in emails and just the simple text?

no not at all, I’m saying it seems like you might be using a HubSpot default email template. HubSpot default emailt templates have in their styls tag styles which use those variables. you should be able to clone and change that but it’s easier to just not use a HS default email template

the RTE isn’t injecting the styles atleast in my experience, unless someone is manually editing the styles in the RTE using the buttons in there.

There’s an inliner attribute that can be applied to style tags which will inline the css like you’re seeing.
Wewp!
here is a screenshot showing how it adds inline styles if you select some of the rich text options
that looks like the expected behavior there.
it is supposed to inline the styles if you click the buttons
I think I missunderstood your intent at first. I understand now.
ok great thanks I think I will add a screenshot like that to the ideas
if you are editing a page in content staging, this back button should take you to the staged content page.  (IMHO)
I’ve posted about this multiple times, 100% agree.
if you post a idea forum post I’ll totally bring my thumbs
you havent already?
no, always just posted in here without an actual forum post
LAZY!
make this stop happening
